metadata.title: CVE-2024-26889 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:Bluetooth: hci_core: Fix possible buffer overflow struct hci_dev_info has afixed size name[8] field so in the event that hdev->name is bigger thanthat strcpy would attempt to write past its size, so this fixes thisproblem by switching to use strscpy.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-26889` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.4.0-189-generic - 5.4.0-189.209
linux-image-5.4.0-189-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-189.209
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-189-generic - 5.4.0-189.209
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-189-lowlatency - 5.4.0-189.209
No subscription required

linux-image-5.15.0-113-generic - 5.15.0-113.123~20.04.1
linux-image-5.15.0-113-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-113.123~20.04.1
